com.mps.deepviolet.api

Class DVFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mps.deepviolet.api.DVFactory

  • public class DVFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Initial entry point for all DeepViolet API work.

    The DeepViolet API is divided across two main functions, online and offline reporting. Online reports like SSL/TLS DAST scans require an online host. However, other features may be used offline like processing and printing PEM encoded X.509 certificates. To get an idea for how to use DeepViolet API take a look at the following examples. 

      IDSession session = DVFactory.initializeSession(url);
 IDVOnEng eng = DVFactory.getIDVOnEng(session);
 IDVCipherSuite[] ciphers = eng.getHostCipherSuites();
 ...iterate over the ciphers, do cool stuff, makes your own custom reports or UI...
    If you only want to print the cipher suites you can do something like this. 
      StringBuffer con = new StringBuffer(2500);
 IDSession session = DVFactory.initializeSession(url);
 IDVOnEng eng = DVFactory.getIDVOnEng(session);
 IDVOnPrint p = getDVOnPrint(con);
 p.printSupportedCipherSuites();
 ...prints some raw text to the console buffer and active logger...
    Also have a look at the code in the samples package for ideas where to begin, 
      com.mps.deepviolet.api.samples
    Author:
    Milton Smith

    • Method Detail

      • initializeSession

        public static final IDVSession initializeSession(java.net.URL url)
                                          throws DVException
        Initialize a session. Required for obtaining an instance of IDVOnEng.
        Parameters:
        url - URL of the host to perform SSL/TLS scan
        Returns:
        Intialized session instance for this host.
        Throws:
        DVException - Thrown on problems initializing host.

      • getDVOffEng

        public static final IDVOffEng getDVOffEng()
        Retrieve an instance of IDVOffEng. Provided since there are some offline functions that don't require an initialized host. For example, reading PEM encoded X.509 certificates.
        Returns:
        Engine instance for offline functions

      • getDVEng

        public static final IDVOnEng getDVEng(IDVSession session)
        Retrieve an instance of IDVOnEng. Use this method for online functions against an intialized host.
        Parameters:
        session - Inialized session from previous call to initializeSession(URL)
        Returns:
        Engine instance for offline functions
        See Also:
        initializeSession(URL)
